p: Based on the IC 50 values, it was observed that the EO of Egyptian ecospecies showed more phytotoxic activity on B. pilosa than Saudi ecospecies. The Egyptian ecospecies attained an IC 50 value of 48.6, 18.7, and 2.3 µL L −1 for germination, seedling shoot growth, and seedling root growth, respectively, while the Saudi ecospecies showed an IC 50 value of 70.9, 32.9, and 5.9 µL L −1, respectively ( Figure 3). The potency of the EO from Egyptian ecospecies on the germination, seedling shoot growth, and seedling root growth of B. pilosa were ≈ 1.5–1.8, and 2.5-fold of Saudi ecospecies.
